entry.title: Secret and Strange Angel
entry.summary:
Author: lilacswraith

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,066Chapters: 1/2Kudos: 0

Summary: "My soul." He clarified, slowly. "Are you here to take it?" "No! I— Bruce you're not dead! You're— you're fine! Er, well, maybe not fine, but alive, definitely—" OR When Bruce was a child, his mother would tell him stories about the Angel that watched over him. These tales of a guardian, intertwined with his soul, weaved through his childhood, faded as he grew, but remained a precious thing, as all the memories he had left of his parents did. Now, decades later, a small part of him can't help reasoning— in a world where magic exists, gods walk the earth, and some of his dearest friends are aliens… was it really so impossible for his Angel to be real? (There are no angels here, but you know what there is? Hallucinogens!) OR A very drugged Bruce mistakes his best friend for the angel his mother always said would protect him. He just has one question— why didn't he? Why did he abandon him? Clark is… bewildered, to put it lightly. And in love, did I mention in love? Written for BW365 2025! Day #265: Smooth

entry.title: Blackbird in Ivy
entry.summary:
Author: sweethoneysuckle (blea_my)

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 60,350Chapters: 19/?Kudos: 424

Summary: College Au- Superbat Clark Kent had the perfect university life—top grades, a steady spot as campus journalist, good friends, and even a girlfriend. Everything was in place until Bruce Wayne transferred in from an elite school,a rich, reckless brat with an insufferably smug, Bruce seems determined to unravel Clark’s perfectly ordered world and seems to live just to get under Clark’s skin… and maybe, under it all, into his world.

entry.title: Superstressed
entry.summary:
Author: Art_Deco_Hitchhiker

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 13,379Chapters: 7/10Kudos: 155

Summary: Clark Kent tries to keep some secrets. From his parents, from his best friend Lois, from the world. He likes to think that he is doing pretty well, dividing his time between his journalism and his Superman shenanigans. He is normal. Nothing strange or otherworldly about him. But when Clark has to interview billionaire Bruce Wayne for The Daily Planet, his carefully crafted image starts tearing at the seams.

entry.title: Sleep Talking
entry.summary:
Author: Mae_eil

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,574Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 6

Summary: Bruce has read the claims of Kant and though he finds the proclamation a noble one, he cannot find himself standing for man's ideas, for no matter how much he intertwines each intention with his love, the follow through clatters out a hollow sound. It doesn’t matter how many times he practices the words in his head, or how long it took for his tongue to become familiar with the shape of I love you falling out of his lips – all is futile if he says nothing at all in the moment of truth.___ Bruce and Clark are on duty Friday night Bruce finds himself wanting in the pockets of quiet they share.
